intro: Gochnatia oligantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gochnatia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Gochnatia oligantha is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
